name: 王永順
objective: Welcome to the NTUT University Table Tennis Coaching Program! This semester-long course is designed to equip students with fundamental and advanced table tennis skills. From mastering the basics of racket handling to executing precision serves and advanced strokes, this course aims to foster a comprehensive understanding of the game. Whether you are a beginner or have prior experience, this class will help you enhance your technical, tactical, and physical skills while promoting teamwork and sportsmanship.
schedule:
Course Objectives:

Build a strong foundation in table tennis basics: grip, stance, and movement.
Develop skills in forehand, backhand, serving techniques, and spins.
Introduce game strategies and foster match-play experience.
Encourage fitness, hand-eye coordination, and reflex enhancement.
Create an enjoyable learning environment promoting personal growth and sportsmanship.

16-Week Semester Syllabus
Weeks 1-2: Fundamentals of Table Tennis

Topics Covered:
Introduction to table tennis equipment
Rules and regulations overview
Correct racket grip (shakehand and penhold grips)
Proper stance and footwork basics
Activities:
Demonstrations and practice drills
Basic ball control and consistency exercises
Weeks 3-4: Forehand Technique

Topics Covered:
Forehand drive mechanics
Generating power and accuracy
Positioning and movement drills for forehand
Activities:
Forehand warm-up routines
Pair practice for forehand rallies
Target-based accuracy challenges
Weeks 5-6: Backhand Technique

Topics Covered:
Backhand drive fundamentals
Transitioning between forehand and backhand
Handling high and low backhand strokes
Activities:
Backhand drills (stationary and moving)
Consistency-building rally exercises
Match scenarios for backhand use
Weeks 7-8: Serving Fundamentals

Topics Covered:
Rules for serving in table tennis
Basic serve types (flat, topspin, backspin)
Importance of spin and placement
Activities:
Practicing basic serves
Serving accuracy and variation challenges
Partner feedback and refinement sessions
Weeks 9-10: Advanced Serves

Topics Covered:
Side-spin serves
Combination spin serves
Deceptive serves to confuse opponents
Activities:
Drill sessions for spin and speed variations
Serve-return scenarios with partners
Individual serve improvement plans
Weeks 11-12: Undercut Techniques

Topics Covered:
Mastering the undercut/backspin stroke
Defensive uses of undercut techniques
Strategies to counter opponent spin
Activities:
Undercut practice with controlled drills
Match-play emphasis on defensive skills
Game simulations focusing on undercut scenarios
Weeks 13-14: Strategy and Match Play

Topics Covered:
Developing match strategies based on opponent analysis
Tactical use of spin, speed, and placement
Combining offensive and defensive styles
Activities:
Practice matches with structured feedback
Team games to enhance collaboration
Video analysis of professional matches
Weeks 15-16: Final Assessment and Match Play

Topics Covered:
Recap of all skills learned
Preparation for final skill evaluation
Conducting tournament-style match play
Activities:
Final practical skill demonstrations
Official in-class tournament
Feedback sessions and goal setting for future growth
scorePolicy:
Grading: 

Skill Development: 45% (Demonstrated improvement in forehand, backhand, serving, and undercut techniques)
Match Play Performance: 45% (Tactical application of skills during matches)

Participation and Effort: 10% (Active engagement in class activities)

Absence: missing one class or one match will have 6 point reduction from final grade. Sick leave or personal affairs absence are excluded, unless otherwise specified for particular reasons.
